title: Smallest Subsequence of Distinct Characters
content_html:
Given a string s, return the lexicographically smallest subsequence of s that contains all the distinct characters of s exactly once.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = "bcabc"
Output: "abc"

Example 2:

Input: s = "cbacdcbc"
Output: "acdb"

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 1000
  • s consists of lowercase English letters.

 

Note: This question is the same as 316: https://leetcode.com/problems/remove-duplicate-letters/
content_markdown:
Given a string `s`, return _the_ _lexicographically smallest_ _subsequence_ _of_ `s` _that contains all the distinct characters of_ `s` _exactly once_.

 

**Example 1:**
    
    
    **Input:** s = "bcabc"
    **Output:** "abc"
    

**Example 2:**
    
    
    **Input:** s = "cbacdcbc"
    **Output:** "acdb"
    

 

**Constraints:**

  * `1 <= s.length <= 1000`
  * `s` consists of lowercase English letters.



 

**Note:** This question is the same as 316: <https://leetcode.com/problems/remove-duplicate-letters/>

**Constraints:**

hints: Greedily try to add one missing character. How to check if adding some character will not cause problems ? Use bit-masks to check whether you will be able to complete the sub-sequence if you add the character at some index i.
